title: Fluctuating FPS?
body:
I recently moved several states, and packed up my computer for about 10 days. Before that, I played League at a pretty consistent 250-300 FPS, but when I turned on my computer yesterday, I had fluctuating frames anywhere between 40 and 200 throughout any game I played. I tried everything on the support board; dusted out my computer, defragged hard drive, cleaned out registry, looked for malware, etc. I even reinstalled the game twice and still nothing's changed.

I dropped all my settings and that didn't help either, so I'm really stuck on what to do next, aside from just straight up reinstall my OS and see if that works, but there's a lot of things I would have to reinstall if I did that so I'm trying to put that off as long as possible. Anyone else having this issue?

replies.body:
Fluctuations in your FPS can be caused by a number of potential factors. I'm curious if you're running Windows 10 and recently installed the anniversary updates. At any rate, a good place to start in troubleshooting FPS issues is by working through the steps in [our guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) for this specific issue.

Let me know if those steps caused any change.

I am running Windows 10, but I'm not sure how to check if the anniversary updates have been implemented. Since I have updates set to auto-install and my Windows Update states that I am up to date, I'm going to assume that the anniversary updates have been installed?

I also spent all of yesterday trying everything in the guide from top to bottom, and still ran into the same issue.

Got it. Since the anniversary updates enabled a feature called Game DVR, which has been causing issues for some players lately, I'd like you to temporarily disable it. [This guide](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) will walk you through doing so. 

Let me know if that caused any change at all.

As an update to this; I've reset my OS and reinstalled League as if I had a brand new computer. Updated drivers and everything, and still running into the same issue. This kinda leads me to think it's a hardware issue, but that honestly doesn't make sense to me as nothing about my hardware has changed since before this issue happened.

It's entirely possible this is related to hardware. My friend once had a video card die on them that was only 2 weeks old. It was quite tragic.

We've narrowed down the potential causes of your issue, so I recommend we tag in our tech team to find the permanent solution. You can reach them by running a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attaching the logfile to a [support ticket submission.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)

As an update to this; I asked around and it turns out my CPU fan was dislodged, and wasn't properly cooling my CPU. I feel kinda dumb now but if anyone else runs into this issue, making sure the CPU fan is secure is a good start.

Tried it; nothing. I don't know if I have the most recent anniversary update, however. I checked my update history and it says my last update was August 9, 2016; before I moved, and I wasn't having issues then.
